question: The _________ mobility of labour will decrease if _________.
options: A. geographical … the government introduces “city-bike rental scheme”
B. geographical … several big companies set up child care centres
C. occupational … the travelling subsidy provided by the government is reduced
D. occupational … licences are required by the government for more professions
explanation: Licensing requirements create barriers to entry, reducing occupational mobility.

question: Suppose the government increases the taxi fare by $2 per trip. Which of the following is most likely to happen?
options: A. The total revenue of taxi drivers will definitely increase.
B. The ratio of short-distance taxi trips to long-distance trips will decrease.
C. The supply of taxi services will increase.
D. The equilibrium quantity of taxi trips will increase.
explanation: A fixed increase in price reduces the relative price of expensive (long-distance) goods, increasing their relative consumption (Alchian-Allen Effect).
